Package my.uum

Class database

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
my.uum.database
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class database extends Thread
The class contain connection for sqlite and the methods with database.

  • Constructor Details

    • database

      public database()

  • Method Details

    • verifySystemAdminEmailLogin

      public static String verifySystemAdminEmailLogin(String getEmail)
      This method verifies the email provided during the system admin login process. It checks if the email exists in the systemadmin table of the database. If the email is found, it returns a success message along with the email. If the email is not found, it throws an IllegalArgumentException and returns an error message. If any database or SQL error occurs, it catches the exception and prints the error message.
      Parameters:
      getEmail - the email provided for verification
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the verification status and requesting the password

    • verifySystemAdminPasswordLogin

      public static String verifySystemAdminPasswordLogin(String getPass)
      This method verifies the password provided during the system admin login process. It retrieves the admin_password values from the systemadmin table in the database and compares them with the given password. If a match is found, it returns a success message indicating the login success along with the menu options available for the system admin. If the password is incorrect, it throws an IllegalArgumentException and returns an error message. The method also catches any database or SQL errors that may occur and prints the error message.
      Parameters:
      getPass - the password provided for verification
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the verification status and providing the menu options

    • displayPendingAdmin

      public static String displayPendingAdmin()
      This method retrieves the list of cafe admin registrations with the status "Pending". It selects the cafe_name, name, email_address, and register_status from the cafeadmin table where the register_status is "Pending". It loops through the result set and builds a response string with the registration details. It also prompts the user to enter the email of the cafe admin they want to check. If any database or SQL errors occur, it catches the exception and prints the error message.
      Returns:
      a response message with the list of pending cafe admin registrations and a prompt for the email

    • displaySelectedAdmin

      public static String displaySelectedAdmin(String cafeAdminId)
      This method retrieves the details of a selected cafe admin registration based on their email address. It selects all columns from the cafeadmin table where the email_address matches the provided cafeAdminId. It loops through the result set and builds a response string with the registration information. The response includes the admin's name, email address, phone numbers, cafe name, inasis name, location link, open and close times, holiday status, and registration status. It also prompts the user to select an action: approve, reject, or view the list of pending registrations. If any database or SQL errors occur, the method catches the exception and prints the error message.
      Parameters:
      cafeAdminId - the email address of the cafe admin registration to display
      Returns:
      a response message with the details of the selected cafe admin registration and action options

    • displayCafeRating

      public static String displayCafeRating(String cafename)
      This method displays the list of user comments for a specific cafeteria. It retrieves the user_name, food_name, cafe_name, rating, and comment from the database by joining the user, foodrating, and foodmenu tables. The query filters the results based on the specified cafe_name. The method loops through the result set and builds a response string with the user comments, including the username, food rating, and comment. It also provides options for the system admin to view other cafeteria's ratings or return to the system admin menu.
      Parameters:
      cafename - the name of the cafeteria to display the ratings for
      Returns:
      a response message with the list of user comments for the specified cafeteria

    • displayAllCafeAdmin

      public static String displayAllCafeAdmin()
      This method retrieves the details of all cafe admins from the database. It selects all columns from the cafeadmin table and loops through the result set to build a response string with the information of all cafe admins. It also catches any database or SQL errors that may occur and prints the error message.
      Returns:
      a response message with the information of all cafe admins

    • displaySelectedCafeAdmin

      public static String displaySelectedCafeAdmin(String getCafe)
      This method retrieves the details of a selected cafe admin based on the cafe name. It selects all columns from the cafeadmin table where the cafe_name matches the provided getCafe. It loops through the result set and builds a response string with the registration information. The response includes the admin's name, email address, phone numbers, cafe name, inasis name, location link, open and close times, holiday status, and registration status. It also catches any database or SQL errors that may occur and prints the error message.
      Parameters:
      getCafe - the name of the cafe admin to display the details for
      Returns:
      a response message with the details of the selected cafe admin

    • deleteSelectedCafeAdmin

      public static String deleteSelectedCafeAdmin(String getCafe)
      This method retrieves the details of a selected cafe admin for deletion based on the cafe name. It selects all columns from the cafeadmin table where the cafe_name matches the provided getCafe. It loops through the result set and builds a response string with the registration information. The response includes the admin's name, email address, phone numbers, cafe name, inasis name, location link, open and close times, holiday status, and a confirmation message for deletion. It also catches any database or SQL errors that may occur and prints the error message.
      Parameters:
      getCafe - the name of the cafe admin to display the details for deletion
      Returns:
      a response message with the details of the selected cafe admin and a confirmation prompt for deletion

    • deleteCafeAdmin

      public static String deleteCafeAdmin(String getCafe)
      This method deletes a cafe admin from the database based on the cafe name. It constructs a DELETE SQL query using the provided getCafe and executes the query. The method returns a success message if the deletion is successful, or an error message otherwise. It catches any SQL exceptions that may occur and prints the stack trace.
      Parameters:
      getCafe - the name of the cafe admin to delete
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the deletion

    • updateApproved

      public static String updateApproved(String cafeadminId)
      This method updates the registration status of a cafe admin to "Approved" in the database. It constructs an UPDATE SQL query and sets the register_status column to "Approved" for the cafe admin with the specified email_address (cafeadminId). The method catches any IllegalArgumentException or SQLException that may occur and returns an appropriate response message indicating the status update result.
      Parameters:
      cafeadminId - the email address of the cafe admin to update the registration status
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the status update

    • updateRejected

      public static String updateRejected(String cafeadminId)
      This method updates the registration status of a cafe admin to "Rejected" in the database. It constructs an UPDATE SQL query and sets the register_status column to "Rejected" for the cafe admin with the specified email_address (cafeadminId). The method catches any IllegalArgumentException or SQLException that may occur and returns an appropriate response message indicating the status update result.
      Parameters:
      cafeadminId - the email address of the cafe admin to update the registration status
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the status update

    • registerCafeAdmin

      public static String registerCafeAdmin(String email, String name, String contact, String officeNum, String cafeName, String inasisName, String locationLink, String openTime, String closeTime, String password, String holidayStatus, String registerStatus)
      This method registers a new cafe admin in the database. It constructs an INSERT SQL query and sets the values for all the columns based on the provided input parameters. The method executes the query and returns a response message indicating the success or failure of the registration. It catches any SQLException that may occur and prints the stack trace.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the cafe admin
      name - the name of the cafe admin
      contact - the contact number of the cafe admin
      officeNum - the office telephone number of the cafe admin
      cafeName - the name of the cafe
      inasisName - the name of the inasis
      locationLink - the location link of the cafe
      openTime - the opening time of the cafe
      closeTime - the closing time of the cafe
      password - the password for the cafe admin
      holidayStatus - the holiday status of the cafe
      registerStatus - the registration status of the cafe admin
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the registration

    • updateFood

      public static String updateFood(String id, String type, String name, String price, String status, String qty, String cafeName)
      This method updates the details of a food item in the database. It constructs an UPDATE SQL query and sets the values for the food_type, food_name, food_price, food_status, food_qty, and cafe_name columns based on the provided input parameters. The method executes the query and returns a response message indicating the success or failure of the update. It catches any SQLException that may occur and prints the stack trace.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the food item to update
      type - the type of the food item
      name - the name of the food item
      price - the price of the food item
      status - the status of the food item
      qty - the quantity of the food item
      cafeName - the name of the cafe associated with the food item
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the update

    • verifyEmailLogin

      public static String verifyEmailLogin(String getEmail)
      This method verifies the email address provided during login for a cafe admin. It retrieves the email addresses and registration status from the cafeadmin table in the database. The method checks if the provided email is approved and matches any of the registered email addresses. If the verification is successful, it returns a response message indicating the success and prompts for the password. If the verification fails, it throws an IllegalArgumentException or returns an appropriate response message.
      Parameters:
      getEmail - the email address to verify
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the email verification

    • verifyPasswordLogin

      public static String verifyPasswordLogin(String getPass)
      This method verifies the password provided during login for a cafe admin. It retrieves the cafe name, name, email address, and password from the cafeadmin table in the database. The method checks if the provided password matches the password stored in the database for the corresponding cafe admin. If the verification is successful, it returns a response message indicating the success and provides menu options for the cafe admin. If the verification fails, it throws an IllegalArgumentException or returns an appropriate response message.
      Parameters:
      getPass - the password to verify
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the password verification

    • displayFoodCafe

      public static String displayFoodCafe(String cafename)
      This method displays the food menu of a specific cafe. It retrieves the food menu items from the foodmenu table in the database for the specified cafe name. The method constructs a response message containing the food menu details and returns it.
      Parameters:
      cafename - the name of the cafe to display the food menu for
      Returns:
      a response message containing the food menu details

    • addNewFood

      public static String addNewFood(String id, String type, String name, String price, byte[] image, String status, String qty, String cafeName)
      This method adds a new food item to the foodmenu table in the database. It constructs an INSERT SQL query and sets the values for the food_id, food_type, food_name, food_price, food_image, food_status, food_qty, and cafe_name columns based on the provided input parameters. The method executes the query and returns a response message indicating the success or failure of the addition. It catches any SQLException that may occur and prints the stack trace.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the new food item
      type - the type of the new food item
      name - the name of the new food item
      price - the price of the new food item
      image - the image of the new food item
      status - the status of the new food item
      qty - the quantity of the new food item
      cafeName - the name of the cafe associated with the new food item
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the addition

    • checkCafe_Name

      public static String checkCafe_Name(String cafename, String email)
      This method checks if the provided cafe name and email address match in the database. It retrieves the cafe name from the cafeadmin table in the database for the provided email address. The method compares the retrieved cafe name with the provided cafe name. If they match, it returns "authorized". Otherwise, it returns "non-authorized".
      Parameters:
      cafename - the cafe name to check
      email - the email address associated with the cafe
      Returns:
      "authorized" if the cafe name and email match, "non-authorized" otherwise

    • checkCafeName

      public static String checkCafeName(String cafename)
      This method checks if a cafe with the provided name exists in the foodmenu table in the database. It retrieves the records from the foodmenu table where the cafe_name matches the provided name. If any records are found, it returns "found". Otherwise, it returns "not found".
      Parameters:
      cafename - the cafe name to check
      Returns:
      "found" if a cafe with the provided name exists, "not found" otherwise

    • searchCafeMenu

      public static String searchCafeMenu(String cafeName)
      This method searches for the food menu of a specific cafeteria. It executes a SELECT SQL query to retrieve the food items from the foodmenu table where the cafe_name matches the provided cafeName parameter. The method constructs a response message containing the food type, name, and price for each item, and returns it.
      Parameters:
      cafeName - the name of the cafeteria to search for
      Returns:
      a response message containing the food menu of the specified cafeteria

    • searchFoodName

      public static String searchFoodName(String foodname, String cafename)
      This method searches for a food item in the foodmenu table based on the food name and cafe name. It executes a SELECT SQL query with the provided food name and cafe name as parameters. If a record is found, it returns "found". Otherwise, it returns "not found".
      Parameters:
      foodname - the name of the food item to search for
      cafename - the name of the cafe to search within
      Returns:
      "found" if the food item is found, "not found" otherwise

    • displayCafeLocation

      public static String displayCafeLocation()
      This method retrieves the cafe names and their location links from the cafeadmin table in the database. It constructs a response message containing the cafe names and location links and returns it.
      Returns:
      a response message containing the cafe names and location links

    • getFoodId

      public static String getFoodId(String foodname)
      This method retrieves the food ID of a food item based on its name. It executes a SELECT SQL query with the provided food name as a parameter. If a record is found, it returns the food ID. Otherwise, it returns an empty string.
      Parameters:
      foodname - the name of the food item to retrieve the ID for
      Returns:
      the food ID if found, an empty string otherwise

    • addFeedback

      public static String addFeedback(String rating, String comment, String userid, String foodid)
      This method adds a new feedback entry to the foodrating table in the database. It constructs an INSERT SQL query and sets the values for the rating, comment, user_id, and food_id columns based on the provided input parameters. The method executes the query and returns a response message indicating the success or failure of the addition. It catches any SQLException that may occur and prints the stack trace.
      Parameters:
      rating - the rating value
      comment - the feedback comment
      userid - the ID of the user providing the feedback
      foodid - the ID of the food item the feedback is for
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the addition

    • checkFoodId

      public static String checkFoodId(String foodId)
      This method checks if a food item with the provided ID exists in the foodmenu table in the database. It executes a SELECT SQL query with the provided food ID as a parameter. If a record is found, it returns "success". Otherwise, it returns "fail".
      Parameters:
      foodId - the ID of the food item to check
      Returns:
      "success" if the food item exists, "fail" otherwise

    • deleteFood

      public static String deleteFood(String id, String cafeName)
      This method deletes a food item from the foodmenu table based on its ID and cafe name. It executes a DELETE SQL query with the provided food ID and cafe name as parameters. If the deletion is successful (rowsDeleted > 0), it returns "Successfully deleted food item". Otherwise, it returns a failure message.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the food item to delete
      cafeName - the name of the cafe associated with the food item
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the deletion

    • addUser

      public static String addUser(String username)
      This method adds a new user entry to the user table in the database. It checks if the provided username already exists in the table. If it exists, it returns "User already exists". If it doesn't exist, it constructs an INSERT SQL query and sets the value for the user_name column. The method executes the query and returns a response message indicating the success or failure of the addition. It catches any SQLException that may occur and prints the stack trace.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to add
      Returns:
      a response message indicating the success or failure of the addition

    • getUserId

      public static String getUserId(String username)
      This method retrieves the user ID for a user based on their username. It executes a SELECT SQL query with the provided username as a parameter. If a record is found, it returns the user ID. Otherwise, it returns an empty string.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to retrieve the ID for
      Returns:
      the user ID if found, an empty string otherwise

    • comparePrice

      public static String comparePrice(String foodname)
      This method compares the prices of a food item across different cafeterias. It retrieves the food prices for the provided food name from the foodmenu table in the database. The method constructs a response message containing the cafeteria names and their corresponding prices, and returns it. If the food item is not found, it returns an appropriate failure message.
      Parameters:
      foodname - the name of the food item to compare prices for
      Returns:
      a response message containing the cafeteria names and their corresponding prices
